thread.title: Global economy faces financial bubble from central bank stimulus, Schaeuble warns
thread.title_full: Global economy faces financial bubble from central bank stimulus, Schaeuble warns

title: Global economy faces financial bubble from central bank stimulus, Schaeuble warns
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Sat, Sep 12, 2015, 06:50 BST - UK Markets closed Global economy faces financial bubble from central bank stimulus, Schaeuble warns By Renae Dyer | Sharecast â€“ 11 hours ago UBGXF 0.00 
  German finance minister Wolfgang Schaeuble on Friday warned of a market bubble caused by central banks injecting stimulus to boost their economies. In his Budget speech in Berlin, Schaeuble also stressed that economic reforms were vital to sustain growth and should not be ignored in place of measures from central banks. 
"When we call for structural reforms in return for financial assistance, this isn't some narrow-minded mantra being repeated by people who have lost sight of the big strategic questions of the future," Schaeuble said. 
"In fact, this may well be the most important long-term strategic question we face today." He added that governments should "take on board the lessons of the last crisis". 
His remarks come after the European Central Bank said it would extend its quantitative easing programme if needed. 
Schaeuble has many times tried to drive home the point that governments should refrain from relying heavily on stimulus from central banks (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) .
